required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Comparison of Silicone Hydrogel Monthly Lenses
clinical_study.official_title: One-month Clinical Comparison of Silicone Hydrogel Monthly Lenses in High Lipid Depositors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare AIR OPTIX® plus HydraGlyde (AOHG) contact lenses to ACUVUE® VITA® (VITA) contact lenses for total lipid uptake (total of surface and bulk uptake) after 30 days of wear by high lipid depositors.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Ex-vivo Total Lipid Uptake (Total of Surface and Bulk Uptake) Per Lens
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 30 after 10 hours of wear, each product
primary_outcome.description: Contact lens was removed aseptically from the eye. Total lipid (fatty deposits) uptake, defined as total amount of lipids (surface and bulk) absorbed/adsorbed and extracted, was measured in micrograms. A lower value indicates better results. Only one lens from each subject contributed to the analysis.

arm_group.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses worn first, followed by senofilcon C contact lenses, as randomized. Each product worn bilaterally (in both eyes) for a total duration of 30 (+ 3) days under a daily wear modality for the specific study period. The lenses will be removed every night and cared for with the subject's habitual lens care solution.

Senofilcon C contact lenses worn first, followed by lotrafilcon B contact lenses, as randomized. Each product worn bilaterally (in both eyes) for a total duration of 30 (+ 3) days under a daily wear modality for the specific study period. The lenses will be removed every night and cared for with the subject's habitual lens care solution.

intervention.description: Silicone hydrogel contact lenses used as per their Conformité Européenne (CE) marking
Silicone hydrogel contact lenses used as per their Conformité Européenne (CE) marking

overall_official.last_name: Clinical Manager, Medical Clinical Trial Services

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from 1 study center located in the United Kingdom.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 114 enrolled, 29 subjects were exited prior to randomization. An additional 4 subjects discontinued after randomization but prior to exposure. This reporting group includes all randomized and exposed subjects (81).

group.title: AOHG Then VITA
group.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses worn first, followed by senofilcon C contact lenses, as randomized. Each product worn bilaterally (in both eyes) for a total duration of 30 (+ 3) days under a daily wear modality for the specific study period. The lenses were removed every night and cared for with the subject’s habitual lens care solution.

group.title: VITA Then AOHG
group.description: Senofilcon C contact lenses worn first, followed by lotrafilcon B contact lenses, as randomized. Each product worn bilaterally for a total duration of 30 (+ 3) days under a daily wear modality for the specific study period. The lenses were removed every night and cared for with the subject’s habitual lens care solution.

participants_list.participants: One subject discontinued after completing Period 1 and was not exposed in Period 2.

baseline.population: This analysis population includes all randomized subjects who were exposed to AOHG or VITA lenses (Full Analysis Set).

group.title: Overall
group.description: Lotrafilcon B and senofilcon C contact lenses worn during Period 1 and Period 2 in a crossover assignment.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Mean Ex-vivo Total Lipid Uptake (Total of Surface and Bulk Uptake) Per Lens
outcome.description: Contact lens was removed aseptically from the eye. Total lipid (fatty deposits) uptake, defined as total amount of lipids (surface and bulk) absorbed/adsorbed and extracted, was measured in micrograms. A lower value indicates better results. Only one lens from each subject contributed to the analysis.
outcome.time_frame: Day 30 after 10 hours of wear, each product
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set with non-missing response

group.title: AOHG
group.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses worn bilaterally for 30 (+ 3) days under a daily wear modality. The lenses were removed every night and cared for with the subject’s habitual lens care solution.

group.title: VITA
group.description: Senofilcon C contact lenses worn bilaterally for 30 (+ 3) days under a daily wear modality. The lenses were removed every night and cared for with the subject’s habitual lens care solution.

measure.title: Mean Ex-vivo Total Lipid Uptake (Total of Surface and Bulk Uptake) Per Lens
measure.description: Contact lens was removed aseptically from the eye. Total lipid (fatty deposits) uptake, defined as total amount of lipids (surface and bulk) absorbed/adsorbed and extracted, was measured in micrograms. A lower value indicates better results. Only one lens from each subject contributed to the analysis.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set with non-missing response

reported_events.time_frame: Dispense through study completion, an average of 2.5 months
reported_events.desc: An adverse event (AE) was defined as any untoward medical occurrence, unintended disease or injury, or untoward clinical signs in subjects, users, or other persons, whether or not related to the study lenses. AEs were obtained through solicited and spontaneous comments from subjects and through observations by the Investigator as outlined in the study protocol.

group.title: AOHG
group.description: All subjects exposed to lotrafilcon B contact lenses

group.title: VITA
group.description: All subjects exposed to senofilcon C contact lenses

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor reserves the right of prior review of any publication or presentation of information related to the study.
